definition: to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard

sentences.english: Today is grandma's 80th birthday, and all the family have got together to congratulate her.
sentences.chinese: 今天是奶奶的80寿诞，全家人聚在一起给奶奶祝寿。

sentences.english: On his birthday, his students wanted to give him a party.
sentences.chinese: 一次逢王的生日，他的门生想给他祝寿。

sentences.english: The army marches before the Queen on her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 军队在女王面前进行步操仪式，为女王祝寿。

sentences.english: Finally, all civil and military officials in the court held high wine glasses to congratulate on Emperor Xuanzong birthday.
sentences.chinese: 最后朝中文武百官高举酒杯齐声为玄宗祝寿。

sentences.english: Even for his mother's birthday , he only bought a kilogram of meat .
sentences.chinese: 给母亲祝寿，也仅买了两斤肉。

sentences.english: Both sides were full of rows of tombs, which seemed like a bun used to celebrate birthday in a better-off family.
sentences.chinese: 两面都已埋到层层叠叠，宛然阔人家里祝寿时的馒头。

sentences.english: Lin said the puppet show is to greet the gods in thank God activities and birthday party oriented.
sentences.chinese: 林老师表示布袋戏在近代演出以迎神谢神和祝寿为主。

sentences.english: As all the daughters' thoughts, I am the happiest daughter in the world for I have the best father.
sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸生日，我请了假回家为他老人家祝寿。

sentences.english: She is really the most beautiful creature that was seen at court upon the birthday.
sentences.chinese: 在祝寿宴会上她是宫庭里见到的最美丽的人。

sentences.english: Two daytime inside complete a large blessing Lu life to wish life diagram, this how may?
sentences.chinese: 两天之内完成一幅大型的福禄寿祝寿图，这怎么可能？

definition: congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
variant of 做壽|做寿[zuo4 shou4]
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes
